intro: Pedicularis cholashanensis, commonly known as the Cholashan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color, and its slender, often hairy stems. It thrives in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
